did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.unittitle: John F. Kennedy 1960 presidential campaign materials 1958-1960
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: John Fitzgerald Kennedy was elected in 1960 as the 35th President of the United States, serving from 1961 until his assassination in Dallas, Texas, in November 1963.

Collection dates from 1958-1960 and consists chiefly of printed literature documenting John F. Kennedy's 1960 Democratic U.S. presidential campaign, including Democratic Party publications, advertising, student campaign manuals, and news articles; it also includes some ephemera such as campaign buttons. Some materials feature Republican opponent Richard M. Nixon as well.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. There may be a 48-hour delay in obtaining these materials.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], John F. Kennedy 1960 campaign materials, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The John F. Kennedy 1960 campaign materials were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Encoded by Jen Snow and Carrie Mills, May 2012

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection dates from 1958-1960 and consists chiefly of printed literature documenting John F. Kennedy's 1960 Democratic U.S. presidential campaign, including Democratic Party publications, advertising, student campaign manuals, and news articles; it also includes some ephemera such as campaign buttons. Some material features Republican opponent Richard M. Nixon as well.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
